metadata.title: CVE-2017-12150 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
It was found that samba before 4.4.16, 4.5.x before 4.5.14, and 4.6.xbefore 4.6.8 did not enforce "SMB signing" when certain configurationoptions were enabled. A remote attacker could launch a man-in-the-middleattack and retrieve information in plain-text.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11').
